query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Public online course for circular textiles
result.description: The focus is on building expertise towards circular ecosystems by • organizing internal webinars tailored for the needs of specific sub-groups in the project to bridge the knowledge gaps identified in Task 6.1 • collecting and developing course materials for a public online course (MOOC) about the ecosystem for circular economy in textile and fashion fields

result.title: FirEUrisk network sustainability plan-v.1
result.description: Key to success of FirEUrisk as a central research pillar is the identification and sensitization of similar EU funded actions. D6.2 will document actions that had been undertaken in order to further cement relationships. Such actions could include common dissemination activities, sharing of tools that have already been developed, strategic alliance in the development of new tools etc. D6.2 will provide information for Y1 and Y2 of FirEUrisk. FirEUrisk network sustainability plan- First version.

result.title: A protocol for Natural Assets profiling and assessment of impacts and dependencies of farming systems on natural capital
result.description: The NAP protocol will define the conceptual and analytical frameworks incuding models and methods to identify and assess onfarm and offfarm value chain impacts and dependencies of farming operations and systems on natural assets and biodiversity The protocol will also serve as guide for profilling natural assets physical chemical and biological state and condition and their trends over time The protocol will be developed in close coordination with Tasks 71 72 61 23 and 32 Task 73

result.title: Review of existing public incentive schemes plus design options
result.description: Based on the literature review and the interviews in pilot clusters a report will be prepared describing existing public incentives as well as promising design options of such incentives that could influence behavior regarding agrobiodiversity management

result.title: Novel DST (FRAMEselect) for agrobiodiversity management
result.description: Novel DST for agrobiodiversity management FRAMEselect developed and tested 'in-house', Beta tested with a selection of potential end-users before Gamma testing on the cluster farms. Baseline assessment undertaken, priorities and targets identified, farm management practices implemented and potential benefits of farm management practices identified (Task 5.3).
